contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=July 2009}} '''George Dweh''' is a [[Liberia]]n [[politician]] and a member of the ethnic [[Krahn]] group operating in the [[Liberians United for Reconciliation and Democracy|LURD]] and the [[Movement for Democracy in Liberia|MODEL]] faction groups. He is also cousin to late President [[Samuel K. Doe]], a Krahn who seized power in a 1980 [[coup d'etat|coup]]. Despite widespread resistance to his appointment amidst allegations of his involvement in numerous massacres,<ref>http://focusonliberia.wordpress.com/2011/11/</ref> Dweh served as Speaker of the [[National Transitional Legislative Assembly of Liberia]] (NTLA) from October 2003 to 14 March 2005, when he was suspended from the body after being accused of financial mismanagement and corruption. Dweh has six children : Georgetta, George, George, Georgina, George jr, and Georgecee Dweh <ref>[http://www.irinnews.org/report.aspx?reportid=53466 "LIBERIA: Appeals for calm amid parliament corruption row"], IRIN, March 17, 2005.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Dweh, George | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Liberian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = March 6, 1961 | PLACE OF BIRTH = monrovia | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dweh, George}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Members of the Legislature of Liberia]] [[Category:Krahn people]] {{Liberia-politician-stub}}
